p: Traditional trivalent influenza vaccines include two inactivated influenza A strains (H1N1 and H3N2) and one influenza B strain, but this has recently been overtaken by quadrivalent influenza vaccine comprised of H1N1, H3N2 and both influenza B lineages that offers a more complete coverage [ 18]. Commercially available vaccine options include egg- or cell-based inactivated influenza vaccine (IIV), a live attenuated influenza vaccine (LAIV), and a recombinant HA vaccine produced in insect cells [ 16].
